data.title: History(PDF:51KB) - Nikon
data.text: 18 History Corporate Steppers Cameras 1910s ● Two of Japan's leading optical manufacturers merge to form a comprehensive, fully integrated optical company known as Nippon Kogaku K.K. (1917) ● Acquisition of Fujii Lens Seisakusho (1917) ● Completion of Ohi Plant (1918) ● Research on manufacture of optical glass initiated (1918) 1920s ● Eight German technicians invited to provide technical guidance (1921) 1930s ● Completion of new Ohi Plant (1933) ● Decided the name of camera lenses as Nikkor (1932) 1940s ● Following end of W.W.II, production shifted to civilian optical products (1945) ● Decided the name of small-sized cameras as Nikon (1946) ● Stock exchange listings gained on both Tokyo and Osaka exchanges (1949) ● Nikon I (1948) 1950s ● Nikkor Club formed to promote popular photography ● The New York Times announced the superior quality of culture (1952) Nikon cameras and Nikkor lenses to the world (1950) ● First service center opened (1953); development of ● Nikon M (1950) ● Nikon S (1951) nationwide network begins ● Nikon S2 (1954) ● Nikon SP (1957) ● First U.S. subsidiary, Nikon Optical Co., established (1953) ● Nikon S3 (1958) ● Nikon S4 (1959) ● Nikon F (Nikon's first SLR camera) (1959) 1960s ● Nikon AG established in Switzerland (1961) ● Nikkorex 35 (1960) ● Nikon S3M (1960) ● Management buy-in with Sakura Electronic Industries, Ltd. ● Nikkorex 35-II (1962) ● Nikon F Photomic (1962) (now Tochigi Nikon Corporation) (1963) ● Nikkorex F (1962) ● Nikkorex Zoom 35 (1963) ● Factory operations commence at Yokohama site (now ● Nikonos (1963) ● Nikon Auto 35 (1964) Yokohama Plant) (1967) ● Nikomat FT [Nikkormat FT]* 1 (1965) ● Photo gallery Ginza Nikon Salon opened (1968) ● Nikomat FS [Nikkormat FS]* 1 (1965) ● K.K.Tachibana Seisakusho (now Mito Nikon Corporation) established (1968) ● Nikon F Photomic T (1965) ● Nikon F Photomic TN (1967) ● Nikon Europe N.V. (now Nikon Europe B.V.) established ● Nikomat FTN [Nikkormat FTN]* 1 (1967) in the Netherlands (1968) ● Nikonos II (1968) ● Nikon Photomic FTN (1968) 1970s ● Nikon House opened in New York (1970) ● Began development of SR-1 Step-and-Repeat System ● Nikomat FTN with Type A screen (1971) ● Factory operations commence at Sagamihara site (now Sagamihara Plant) (1971) (Entrusted by VLSI technology research group) (1976) ● Nikon F2 (1971) ● Nikon F2 Photomic (1971) ● Shinjuku Nikon Salon opened (1971) ● Completion of SR-1 (1978) ● Nikon Photomic FTN loaded on APOLLO 15 (1971) ● Sendai Nikon Corporation established (1971) ● Nikomat EL [Nikkormat EL]* 1 (1972) ● Nikon Vertriebs GmbH (now Nikon GmbH) ● Nikon F2 Photomic S (1973) ● Nikomat FTN (1973) established in West Germany (now Germany) (1971) ● Nikomat FT2 [Nikkormat FT2]* 1 (1975) ● Nikon Optical Shop Co., Ltd. established (1973) ● Nikonos III (1975) ● Osaka Nikon Salon opened (1974) ● Nikomat ELW [Nikkormat ELW]* 1 (1976) ● Aiko Lens K.K. (now Aichi Nikon Co., Ltd.) established (1974) ● Nikon F2 Photomic S B (1976) ● Nikon Live Galerie opened in Zurich, Switzerland (1976) ● Shift of SLR lens type to Ai (1977) ● Nikko Engineering K.K. (now Nikon Engineering Co., Ltd.) ● Nikon F2 Photomic A (1977) established (1978) ● Nikomat FT3 [Nikkormat FT3]* 1 (1977) ● Nikon Canada Inc. established in Canada (1978) ● Nikon FM (1977) ● Nikon EL2 (1977) ● Nikon U.K. Ltd. established in U.K. (1979) ● Nikon F2 Photomic AS (1977) ● Nikon FE (1978) ● Nasu Optical K.K. (now Nasu Nikon Co., Ltd.) established (1979) ● Nikon F2/Titanium model (Limited edition) (1979) 1980 ● Acquired Kurobane Kogaku K.K. (now Kurobane Nikon Co., Ltd.) ● NSR-1010G (Resolution: 1.0µm) : First stepper made in Japan ● Nikon EM ● Nikon F3 ● Nikonos IV-A 1981 ● Nikon Inc. established in the United States ● NSR-1505G (Resolution: 1.2µm) ● Zao Nikon Co., Ltd. established ● NSR-2005G (Resolution: 1.5µm) 1982 ● Nikon Precision Inc. established in the United States ● Production facilities for steppers completed in Yokohama Plant ● Nikon F3 High-eyepoint ● The first stepper shipped to the United States ● Nikon FM2 ● Nikon FG ● Nikon F3T 1983 ● Production space for steppers in Yokohama Plant ● Nikon FE2 ● Nikon L35AF expanded ● Nikon F3AF ● Nikon L35AD ● Nikon FA 1984 ● Completion of Kumagaya Plant ● NSR-1505G2A (Resolution: 1.0µm) ● Nikon New FM2 ● Nikon FG-20 (Operations initiated in 1985) ● NSR-1505G3A (Resolution: 1.0µm) ● Nikon L135AF ● NSR-1010i3 (Resolution: 0.8µm) ● Nikonos V ● Nikon FA Gold (Limited edition) 1985 ● Cascading CI activities, terminated in March 1989 ● NSR-HT3025G (Resolution: 2.0µm) ● Nikon F-301 [N2000]* 2 ● First representative office in China opened in Beijing ● Nikon L35AF2 [One-Touch]* 2 ● Nikon L35AD2 [One-Touch]* 2 1986 ● Nikon Hong Kong Ltd. established in Hong Kong ● NSR-L7501G (for LCD) ● Nikon F-501 [N2020]* 2 ● Nikon Systems Inc. established ● Nikon L35TWAF [Tele-Touch]* 2 ● Nikon France S.A. established in France ● Nikon L35TWAD [Tele-Touch]* 2 ● Nikon L35AWAF [Action-Touch]* 2 ● Nikon L35AWAD [Action-Touch]* 2 1987 ● Nikon Tec Corporation established ● NSR-1505G4B (Resolution: 0.9µm) ● Nikon AF3/AD3 [One-Touch]* 2 ● Nikon Sales-Promotion Co., Ltd. established ● NSR-1505G4C (Resolution: 0.8µm) ● Nikon RF/RD [Fun-Touch]* 2 ● SX-5 (Resolution: 0.5µm) ● Nikon L35AWAD (Orange) (Limited edition) ● NSR-1505G4D (Resolution: 0.75µm) ● Nikon F-401/F-401 QD [N4004/N4004 QD]* 2 ● Cumulative sales of steppers reached 1,000 units ● Nikon TW2/TW2D [Tele-Touch Deluxe]* 2 1988 ● Nikon Photo Products Inc. established ● NSR-1505EX (Resolution: 0.5µm) ● Nikon F-801 [N8008]* 2 ● Changed company name to Nikon Corporation ● NSR-1505G5C (Resolution: 0.8µm) ● Nikon TWZOOM [Zoom-Touch 500]* 2 ● Nikon Precision Europe GmbH established in West Germany ● NSR-1505G5D (Resolution: 0.75µm) ● Nikon RF2/RD2 [One-Touch 100]* 2 (now Germany) ● NSR-1505G6E (Resolution: 0.65µm) ● Nikon F4/F4s ● Nikon Optical Canada Inc. established in Canada 1989 ● VISUCOMLAND (electronic imaging equipment ● NSR-L1001G (for LCD) ● NSR-1505i6A (Resolution: 0.65µm) ● Nikon F-401s/F-401s QD [N4004s/N4004s QD]* 2 showroom) opened ● Cumulative sales of steppers reached 2,000 units ● Nikon TW20 QD [Tele-Touch 300]* 2 ● NSR-1755G7A (Resolution: 0.65µm) ● Completion of the second phase of construction work for Kumagaya Plant 1990 ● Nikon Precision Korea Ltd. established in Korea ● NSR-1755i7A (Resolution: 0.5µm) ● FX-201B (for LCD) ● Nikon F-601 [N6006]* 2 /F-601 QD [N6006 QD]* 2 / ● Sagami Optical Co., Ltd. established (dissolved in 2002) ● NSR-2005G8C (Resolution: 0.55µm) F-601M [N6000]* 2 ● Nikon (Thailand) Co.,Ltd. established in Thailand ● Completion of the new building of Nikon Precision Inc. ● Nikon TW ZOOM 35-70 QD [Zoom-Touch 400]* 2 in Belmont, California, U.S.A. ● Completion of the third phase of construction work for Kumagaya Plant Years during which products launched in Japan. Some of the products mentioned above are marketed solely in Japan. [ ]* 1 : Product names mainly used in Germany. [ ]* 2 : Product names mainly used in the United States.
